含义: The character '九' means 'nine' in Chinese. It is a numeral and represents the number 9.
字形: The character '九' consists of two strokes. It starts with a horizontal stroke from left to right, followed by a vertical stroke that curves slightly to the right at the bottom.
读音: The pronunciation of '九' is 'jiǔ' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '九' originates from ancient Chinese pictographs. It is believed to have evolved from a symbol representing a bent arm or a hook, which later came to signify the number nine.
常用词组: 九州 (jiǔ zhōu) - Nine Provinces (an ancient term for China)
九牛一毛 (jiǔ niú yī máo) - A drop in the ocean
成语: 九牛一毛 (jiǔ niú yī máo) - A drop in the ocean
九死一生 (jiǔ sǐ yī shēng) - A narrow escape from death
九九归一 (jiǔ jiǔ guī yī) - All things return to one
例句: 九月是秋天的开始。 (September is the beginning of autumn.)
九牛一毛的事情不值得担心。 (A drop in the ocean is not worth worrying about.)
短故事: In ancient China, the number nine was considered the ultimate yang number and was associated with the emperor. The Forbidden City in Beijing is said to have 9,999 rooms, just one short of the mythical 10,000 rooms of the heavenly palace, to show the emperor's humility.

The 'Nine Songs' (九歌) is a collection of ancient Chinese shamanistic poems, which are part of the 'Chu Ci' (楚辞) anthology. These poems are believed to have been used in rituals to invoke deities and spirits.
诗词: 《九月九日忆山东兄弟》 - 王维 (Wang Wei)
独在异乡为异客，每逢佳节倍思亲。遥知兄弟登高处，遍插茱萸少一人。
帝子降兮北渚，目眇眇兮愁予。袅袅兮秋风，洞庭波兮木叶下。
